intro: Sebastiania marginata var. genuina, commonly known as the Brazilian wax tree, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences. It thrives in tropical climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage. The leaves are also used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
